content:
• Thursday, December 13, 2018
  • SBUX

    Starbucks -3% after forecasting modest same-store sales growth

    • Starbucks (NASDAQ:SBUX) -3.1% after-hours in response to the company's forecast for global same-store sales growth of 3%-4% annually in the long term, roughly in line with a forecast that estimates sales growth to be at the lower end of a 3%-5% range this year.
    • SBUX trims its outlook for long-term annual EPS growth to at least 10%, after it had re-set the forecast in November 2017 to 12% or greater, which was down from a previous forecast of 15%-20% growth; it expects long-term consolidated revenue growth of 7%-9%, in line with its previous target.
    • The company reaffirms in-line guidance for FY 2019, seeing EPS of $2.61-$2.66 vs. $2.65 analyst consensus estimate on revenue growth of 5%-7%, implying $26B-$26.5B vs. $26.1B consensus.
    • SBUX also said earlier today it would raise its store footprint in China to 6,000 stores across 230 cities over the next four years, up from 3,600 stores in 150 cities, and unveiled plans to expand coffee delivery across the U.S. via a partnership with Uber Eats.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:57 PM | 20 Comments
  • TIK

    CLMT, COST, SHOP and SNH among notable After hours movers

    • Top Gainers: TIK +22.2%. SNH +6.1%. EEFT +3.4%. CLMT +3.2%. RAMP +3.2%.
    • Top Losers: HIMX -3.5%. SHOP -3.4%. COST -2.9%. EPZM -2.5%. LNT -2.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:47 PM | 12 Comments
  • LNT

    Alliant Energy to launch $326M public share offering

    • Alliant Energy (NASDAQ:LNT) -2.4% after-hours on news of a planned public offering of $326M in common stock, with an underwriters option to purchase as much as $48.9M of additional common shares.
    • In connection with the offering, LNT says it intends to enter into forward sale agreements with Goldman Sachs and Bank of America.
    • LNT says it plans to use the proceeds for general corporate purposes, which may include repayment or refinancing of debt, working capital, construction and acquisition expenditures, investments and repurchases and redemptions of securities.
    • Separately, LNT appoints John Larsen as its new President and COO as well as CEO of Interstate Power and Light and Wisconsin Power and Light.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:06 PM
  • SHOP

    Shopify -3% on share offering

    • Shopify (NYSE:SHOP) launches an offering of 2.6M Class A subordinate voting shares through Morgan Stanley and Credit Suisse.
    • Shopify will use the net proceeds to strengthen its balance sheet to provide growth flexibility.
    • SHOP is down 3.3% aftermarket to $155.80.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:43 PM | 27 Comments
  • SGMS

    Scientific Games +4% on Shuffle settlement

    • Scientific Games (NASDAQ:SGMS) announces reaching a litigation settlement that will pay Shuffle Tech International and other plaintiffs a total of $151.5M, which is about 45% of the jury award.
    • In August, a jury awarded Shuffle's side $105M in damages plus attorney's fees and costs, which brought the total up to $335M.
    • Scientific Games shares are up 4.3% aftermarket to $16.44.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:35 PM | 3 Comments
  • COST

    Costco shows off strong comparable sales

    • Costco (NASDAQ:COST) reports comparable sales increased 7.5% in Q3 on an adjusted basis.
    • Comparable sales were up 8.3% in the U.S. and 5.5% in Canada. The other international business saw a 5.8% comp.
    • Net income for the quarter was $767M vs. $640M a year ago.
    • E-commerce sales jumped 26.2% during the quarter.
    • The company's EPS mark of $1.73 for the quarter topped even the highest estimate turned in by analysts.
    • Previously: Costco Wholesale misses by $0.01, beats on revenue (Dec. 13)
    • COST -3.27% AH to $219.00.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:27 PM | 14 Comments
  • ENPH

    Enphase Energy discloses 7.5M-share secondary offering

    • Enphase Energy (NASDAQ:ENPH) -6.2% after-hours after disclosing a 7.5M-share common stock offering by selling shareholders.
    • The shares initially were issued pursuant to an asset purchase agreement with SunPower Corp.
    • ENPH will not receive any proceeds from the sale of shares by the selling stockholder.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:27 PM | 10 Comments
  • AXON

    Axovant in-licenses two new gene therapies, shares up 6% after hours

    • Axovant Sciences (NASDAQ:AXON) is up 6% after hours in response to its announcement that it has secured exclusive global rights to two gene therapy programs from the University of Massachusetts Medical School. The candidates will potentially treat two inherited enzyme deficiency disorders called GMI gangliosidosis, also known as Landing disease, and GM2 gangliosidosis which includes Tay-Sachs disease and Sandhoff disease.
    • Under the term of the license agreement, UMass Med School will receive undisclosed development, regulatory and commercial milestones.
    • Both gene therapies, AXO-AAV-GM1 and AXO-AAV-GM2, are designed to introduce function copies of the respective genes that encode the defective or absent enzymes.
    • The GM1 therapy should enter the clinic in H1 2019 with preliminary data expected in H2 2019. The first patient has been dosed with GM2 with initial data expected next quarter.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:27 PM
  • ADBE

    Adobe reports mixed Q4, updates FY guidance

    • Adobe (NASDAQ:ADBE) shares gain 0.4% aftermarket on Q4 results that narrowly beat EPS and missed revenue estimates. Q1 guidance has revenue of $2.54B and EPS of $1.60.
    • The company updates its FY19 guidance to include the Marketo acquisition and revenue and EPS now stand at $11.15B and $7.75, respectively.
    • Earnings call is scheduled for 5 PM ET with a webcast available here.
    • Press release.
    • Update: Post updated to correct that EPS was a beat, not a miss, once a $0.03 acquisition charge was removed.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:20 PM | 7 Comments
  • ADBE

    Adobe Systems beats by $0.02, beats on revenue

    • Adobe Systems (NASDAQ:ADBE): Q4 Non-GAAP EPS* of $1.90 beats by $0.02; GAAP EPS* of $1.48 beats by $0.02.
    • Non-GAAP EPS (incl acquisition) of $1.83; GAAP EPS of $1.37
    • Revenue of $2.46B (+23.0% Y/Y) beats by $30M.
    • Shares +2.7%.
    • Press Release
    • *excluding Marketo acquisition as consensus doesn't account for it
     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM | 17 Comments
  • AMZN

    Report: AWS replaces Juniper routers

    • Amazon (NASDAQ:AMZN) Web Services has been replacing some of its Juniper Networks (NYSE:JNPR) routers and switches with in-house hardware, according to The Information sources.
    • The change has happened over the past few quarters.
    • Juniper shares closed today down 1.3% to $28.10.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:06 PM | 20 Comments
  • DB

    Deutsche Bank gets more scrutiny on Capitol Hill: WSJ

    • Deutsche Bank (NYSE:DB) declines 2.1% after two Democratic senators ask Republicans controlling the Senate Banking Committee to start a "thorough, detailed bipartisan committee investigation" into the bank, the Wall Street Journal reports.
    • The request comes from Senators Elizabeth Warren of Massachusetts and Chris Van Hollen of Maryland, who want the Senate to investigate the German bank's activities and Russia and its role in the money-laundering probes connected with Danske Bank's Estonian branch.
    • Warren and Van Hollen asked for a public hearing as well as an investigation into its role as a correspondent bank handling international money transfers for other banks.
    • They said they want to know more about Deutsche Bank's role of bringing foreign money into the U.S. banking system.
    • Previously: Deutsche Bank raid continues for second day (Nov. 30)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:41 PM | 6 Comments
  • MPLX

    MPLX reinstated at Overweight, ANDX at Equal Weight by Barclays

    • MPLX (MPLX +2.1%) is resumed with an Overweight rating and $40 price target at Barclays, which says the company is in the midst of a broader transformation from a Northeast-concentrated G&P company to a sizable crude and liquids logistics player with a nationwide footprint.
    • As MPLX continues to build out its Permian and Gulf Coast assets in the coming years, the firm sees exposure to these assets as driving incremental returns on the back of significant G&P cash flows.
    • Meanwhile, Barclays resumes coverage of Andeavor Logistics (ANDX +3.1%) at Equal Weight with a $36 price target, seeing limited near-term upside given the anticipated combination with MPLX.
    • The firm also notes Marathon Petroleum's comments around ANDX's need to improve coverage and leverage to maintain independent sustainability.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:34 PM | 15 Comments
  • SBUX

    Highlights from Starbucks' investor conference

    • Stabucks (SBUX +0.9%) management struck a confident tone at today's investor day event, highlighted by an expectation for improved growth in China and the U.S.
    • The company says it's bringing the "third place" to China in a major way. Over the next four years, it plans to grow the store base to 6K stores across 230 cities, up from 3.6K stores in 150 cities currently.
    • In the U.S., Starbucks sees a big opportunity to grow in the Midwest.
    • As for menu innovation, Starbucks expects to introduce Nestle products next year, as well as cold brew Nitro drinks in company-owned U.S. stores.
    • Starbucks notes that it's still growing its market share in the global coffeeshop market faster than peers.
    • On the capital allocation front, the company aims to return $25B to shareholders in FY18 to FY20.
    • Earlier, Starbucks announced a new partnership with Uber Eats.
    • Starbucks investor day webcast
     
     
     
     
    | 3:10 PM | 19 Comments
  • QD

    CIEN, LLNW and QD among top tech movers

    • Gainers: Qudian (NYSE:QD) +32%. Frequency Electronics (NASDAQ:FEIM) +12%. Qutoutiao (NASDAQ:QTT) +12%. Ciena (NASDAQ:CIEN) +8%. MER Telemanagement Solutions (NASDAQ:MTSL) +7%.
    • Losers: Limelight Networks (NASDAQ:LLNW) -26%. CounterPath (NASDAQ:CPAH) -24%. Uxin (NASDAQ:UXIN) -20%. Remark Holdings (NASDAQ:MARK) -16%. eMagin (NYSEMKT:EMAN) -14%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:01 PM
  • OXM

    Earnings malaise in apparel sector

    • Shattering earnings reports from Oxford Industries (OXM -10.8%), Stitch Fix (SFIX -6.8%) and Tailored Brands (TLRD -30.2%) have sent a shiver through the broad apparel sector.
    • Investors seem to have their eyes on the weaker-than-anticipated profit guidance from the trio.
    • Decliners include PVH (PVH -3.9%), Hanesbrands (HBI -6.7%), G-III Apparel (GIII -5.3%), Sequential Brands (SQBG -3.2%) and Genesco (GCO -4.9%).
     
     
     
     
    | 2:57 PM | 8 Comments
  • HBM

    Waterton plans to nominate majority slate for Hudbay Minerals board

    • P-E firm Waterton Global Resource says it plans to nominate several candidates to Hudbay Minerals' (HBM -2.5%) board and urges the miner to replace its CEO, citing what it says is the company’s "massive value destruction and chronic underperformance."
    • Waterton, which owns a ~10% stake in HBM, also says it has withdrawn its request for a special shareholders meeting.
    • The P-E firm says it is finalizing its recruitment of a majority slate of director candidates including a "transformational potential CEO" to nominate for election at HBM's 2019 annual meeting.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:56 PM | 3 Comments
  • FTCH

    Farfetch's purchase of Stadium Goods seen as strategic

    • The Business of Fashion weighs in on Farfetch's (FTCH +0.8%) acquisition of Stadium Goods.
    • "The London-based fashion e-commerce platform is aiming to extend its reach in the growing luxury sneakers and streetwear market, as millennials account for a growing percentage of luxury sales and competitors are engaged in a digital land grab," writes Chantal Fernandez.
    • Farfetch is locked in a race against MatchesFashion and Richemont’s Yoox Net-a-Porter to add new services and technologies through investments, acquisitions and internal R&D, notes Fernandez.
    • Shares of Farfetch are up over 6% since the deal was announced.
    • Previously: Farfetch adds sneaker marketplace to the mix (Dec. 12)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:32 PM

  • Andy Hall is back, and bullish on oil

    • Longtime oil bull Andy Hall shuttered his hedge fund in the summer of 2017 after major losses in the first half of that year.
    • Markets are cruel ... Not long after the closing, black gold set off on a bull run that would take it from about $40 per barrel to more than $70 (before crashing again to its current $52).
    • Speaking today on Bloomberg, Hall's bullish, saying the recent big drop in prices is likely to spur demand. He doesn't think the globe is about the fall into recession, and notes China tends to build stockpiles when prices decline.
    • Further, U.S. shale production is especially responsive to prices, so he expects a sizable decline on that front.
    • ETFs: USO, OIL, UWT, UCO, DWT, SCO, BNO, DBO, UGA, DTO, USL, DNO, OLO, UHN, SZO, OLEM, WTIU, OILK, OILX, WTID, USOI, USOU, USOD, OILD, OILU, USAI
     
     
     
     
    | 2:03 PM | 9 Comments
  • BTE

    Baytex Energy and Valhi among Energy/Materials gainers; Seadrill and Hornbeck Offshore Services among the losers

    • Gainers: Baytex Energy (NYSE:BTE) +11%. Valhi (NYSE:VHI) +11%. American Midstream Partners (NYSE:AMID) +6%. Crestwood Equity Partners (NYSE:CEQP) +5%.
    • Losers: Seadrill (NYSE:SDRL) -13%. Hornbeck Offshore Services (NYSE:HOS) -10%. Comstock Resources (NYSE:CRK) -10%. Ring Energy (NYSEMKT:REI) -8%. Helix Energy Solutions Group (NYSE:HLX) -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:00 PM | 6 Comments
  • WYNN

    Chanos warns on Wynn Resorts and Las Vegas Sands

    • Jim Chanos issues a warning on Wynn Resorts (WYNN -0.7%) and Las Vegas Sands (LVS -0.3%) due to the potential the casino companies could be a casualty of an escalation in the U.S.-China trade war.
    • The investor says he is long Hong Kong-based Melco Resorts & Entertainment (MLCO -2.3%) and short both Wynn and Las Vegas Sands.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:44 PM | 33 Comments
  • HIIQ

    Health Insurance Innovations up 26% on regulatory settlement

    • Health Insurance Innovations (HIIQ +25.9%) is up on double normal volume in response to its disclosure that it has agreed to pay $3.4M to settle an investigation into its business practices by insurance regulators. Under the terms of the agreement, it has also agreed to:
    • Submit a third-party administrator license application in any jurisdiction where required and where it is not already licensed.
    • Improve its monitoring of sales calls via the recording and retention of all internal and external calls. This requirement will apply to external distributors as well.
    • Periodically submit reports to monitoring regulators.
    • Prepare and implement a "disclosure plan" to ensure that all customers are fully aware of policy details and fees, a "compliance plan" aimed at monitoring and improving sales practices and a "training plan" for internal and external sales personnel and related parties regarding compliance with applicable insurance laws. Monitoring regulators will approve all plans.
    • Failure to comply with any aspect of the above items will subject the company to further enforcement and administrative actions.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:36 PM | 5 Comments
  • NLSN

    CNBC: Nielsen to talk with private bidders in January; shares +1.5%

    • A go-private effort for Nielsen (NYSE:NLSN) is heating up, with the company planning management presentations for interested private-equity buyers in January, CNBC reports.
    • Shares have jumped 1.5% on the report.
    • That follows one hurdle being cleared by naming a new CEO: Former IBMer David Kenny took over as chief on Dec. 3.
    • Now Blackstone (NYSE:BX) will meet Kenny next month along with Hellman & Friedman, and Bain Capital will as well, with other P-E firms joining meetings in January.
    • Madison Dearborn was also reported to be interested earlier this month, one of at least seven potential bidders.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:28 PM
  • CI

    California regulator blesses Cigna - Express Scripts tie-up

    • California Department of Managed Health Care Director Shelley Rouillard has approved Cigna's (CI +0.9%) planned merger with Express Scripts (ESRX +1.3%).
    • The regulator's blessing was conditional on the companies' agreement not to increase premiums as a result of acquisition costs and to keep premium rate increases to a minimum. In addition, both firms have agreed to invest $60M in California's healthcare system.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:20 PM | 4 Comments
  • CLVS

    European advisory group backs expanded use of Clovis' Rubraca; shares up 4%

    • Clovis Oncology (CLVS +3.6%) is up on below-average volume following its announcement that the European Medicines Agency's advisory group CHMP has adopted a positive opinion backing the use of Rubraca (rucaparib) as monotherapy for the maintenance treatment of adult patients with platinum-sensitive relapsed high-grade epithelial ovarian, fallopian tube, or primary peritoneal cancer who are in response (complete or partial) to platinum-based chemo.
    • Rubraca is currently approved in the EU as monotherapy treatment of adult patients with platinum sensitive, relapsed or progressive, BRCA mutated (germline and/or somatic), high-grade epithelial ovarian, fallopian tube, or primary peritoneal cancer, who have been treated with two or more prior lines of platinum based chemotherapy, and who are unable to tolerate further platinum based chemotherapy.
    • A final decision from the European Commission usually takes ~60 days.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:08 PM | 1 Comment
  • LOOP

    PPDAI Group and Loop Industries among financial gainers; Maiden Holdings and EverQuote among losers

    • Gainers: Loop Industries (NASDAQ:LOOP) +11%. PPDAI Group (NYSE:PPDF) +11%. Blue Capital Reinsurance Holdings (NYSE:BCRH) +10%. Sirius International Insurance Group (SG) +8%.
    • Losers: Yangtze River Port and Logistics (NASDAQ:YRIV) -17%. Maiden Holdings (NASDAQ:MHLD) -10%. EverQuote (NASDAQ:EVER) -9%. Old Point Financial (NASDAQ:OPOF) -7%. Broadway Financial (NASDAQ:BYFC) -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:00 PM | 2 Comments
  • BHP

    As decision nears, BHP investors divided on Jansen potash project

    • BHP (BHP +1.7%) may be heading for another clash with investors as it moves closer to a decision on whether to build, sell or mothball its $20B Jansen potash project in Saskatchewan, Bloomberg reports.
    • Investors and analysts are skeptical, as construction of the project would mean getting into a new commodity dominated by a small handful of producers.
    • While the outlook for potash has improved, Jansen "is not a project that at this stage we think deserves serious consideration," says a Sydney-based analyst at Pendal Group, which holds BHP shares. "It should be shelved or sold."
    • The company has better growth options to pursue in its portfolio, including expansions of existing coal and copper assets, says a senior investment officer at Argo Investments, which also owns BHP shares.
    • Potash "demand growth is not stellar, supply is abundant, there’s plenty of idled capacity that seems to be waiting in the wings," says Bernstein analyst Paul Gait.
    • A decision is likely next year; BHP is nearing completion on two 3,300-ft. deep shafts, which it says will be a trigger to decide whether to move forward with an initial $5B development.
    • BHP believes it has the world’s best undeveloped potash assets and the business could eventually rival its iron ore unit in scale, CEO Andrew Mackenzie has said.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:59 PM

  • Airline trouble has transports at one-year low

    • The S&P 500 and DJIA are little-changed, but the Transports are lower by more than 2%. Sending that sector into the red are the airlines. Delta is leading the way, down 4.5% after introducing soft guidance for 2019.
    • The iShares Transportation Average ETF (IYT -1.9%).
    • ETFs: IYT, XTN, FTXR, XKST
     
     
     
     
    | 12:50 PM | 9 Comments
  • ADIL

    XPO, LLNW and TLRD among notable midday movers

    • Gainers: Adial Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ADIL) +63%. Yulong Eco-Materials Limited (NASDAQ:YECO-OLD) +26%. Qudian (NYSE:QD) +25%. Kezar Life Sciences (NASDAQ:KZR) +21%. Qutoutiao (NASDAQ:QTT) +17%. Marin Software (NASDAQ:MRIN) +16%. Forty Seven (NASDAQ:FTSV) +14%. Vince Holding (NYSE:VNCE) +14%. Neurotrope (NASDAQ:NTRP) +13%.
    • Losers: Applied Genetic Technologies (NASDAQ:AGTC) -48%. Tailored Brands (NYSE:TLRD) -30%. Limelight Networks (NASDAQ:LLNW) -28%. Fred's (NASDAQ:FRED) -25%. XPO Logistics (NYSEMKT:XPO) -18%. Yangtze River Port and Logistics (NASDAQ:YRIV) -17%. Level Brands (NYSEMKT:LEVB) -17%. Uxin (NASDAQ:UXIN) -16%. LiveXLive Media (NASDAQ:LIVX) -16%. Aileron Therapeutics (NASDAQ:ALRN) -19%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:43 PM | 1 Comment
  • DAL

    Weak guidance sends Delta and peers lower

    • Delta Air Lines (DAL -4.5%) and peers fall after the company's 2019 guidance arrives below the consensus estimate of analysts.
    • The midpoint of the company's 2019 EPS range is $6.50 vs. $6.70 consensus.
    • Notable decliners include American Airlines Group (AAL -4%), United Continental (UAL -3.3%), SkyWest (SKYW -4.7%), Allegiant Travel (ALGT -3.5%) and Hawaiian Holdings (HA -2.7%).
    • Previously: Delta updates financial targets (Dec. 13)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:22 PM | 28 Comments
  • FTSV

    Forty Seven up 14%

    • Relatively recent IPO Forty Seven (FTSV +13.9%) is up on average volume. Shares have rallied over 80% since mid-November when it released its Q3 report.
    • The immuno-oncology firm develops therapies that block a cancer cell surface protein called CD47. Lead candidate is Phase 2-stage 5F9, a humanized IgG4 monoclonal antibody, which works by binding to a certain CD47 receptor on immune system cells called macrophages that cancer cells rely on to avoid detection.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:10 PM
  • VNCE

    Vince Holding and DAVIDsTEA consumer gainers; Under Armour and UQM Technologies among losers

    • Gainers: Vince Holding (NYSE:VNCE) +14%. DAVIDsTEA (NASDAQ:DTEA) +6%.
    • Losers: Xcel Brands (NASDAQ:XELB) -8%. YETI Holdings (NYSE:YETI) -8%. Oxford Industries (NYSE:OXM) -7%. Under Armour (NYSE:UA) -7%. UQM Technologies (NYSEMKT:UQM) -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:06 PM
  • ULTI

    Ultimate Software gains on Evercore upgrade

    • Evercore upgrades Ultimate Software (NASDAQ:ULTI) from In-Line to Outperform with a $310 price target.
    • ULTI reported Q3 beats in late October with revenue up 22% Y/Y.
    • ULTI shares are up 1.2% to $254.17.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:06 PM
  • MDSO

    Medidata -2% on JPMorgan downgrade

    • JPMorgan downgrades Medidata Solutions (NASDAQ:MDSO) from Neutral to Underweight with a $74 price target.
    • Analyst Sterling Auty says the firm needs to see consistent execution improvement before raising estimates.
    • Medidata shares are down 2.2% to $72.24.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:00 PM | 1 Comment
  • ATGFF

    AltaGas cuts dividend by 56%, to sell stake in B.C. power project for C$1.4B

    • AltaGas (OTCPK:ATGFF +10.6%) surges despite announcing a 56% dividend cut to $0.96/share annually, or a monthly dividend of C$0.08/share from $0.1825 previously.
    • The cut comes as the company said it agreed to sell its remaining 55% interest in the Northwest Hydro Facilities in British Columbia to a joint venture controlled by Axium Infrastructure and Manulife Financial (NYSE:MFC) for C$1.39B; AltaGas sold a 35% stake in the operation to the same JV earlier this year.
    • AltaGas also says it has targeted an additional $1.5B-$2B in asset sales next year as part of a plan to regain financial strength and flexibility to fund future growth opportunities with a focus on its midstream and U.S. utilities business.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:56 AM | 21 Comments
  • BTHE

    Boston Therapeutics inks Sugardown distribution deal in Asia

    • Boston Therapeutics (OTCQB:BTHE -11.9%) has entered into a co-marketing agreement with China Hiking Group's Jin Long Health for the promotion of Sugardown chewable tablets in China. Financial terms are not disclosed.
    • The stock is down but only on turnover of 500 shares.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:52 AM
  • CGC

    Congress passes farm bill, legalizes hemp production

    • Congress has backed a $867B farm bill. The House voted 386-47 in favor yesterday following an 87-13 thumbs up in the Senate the day before. President Trump is expected to sign it despite his preference for more stringent food stamp eligibility.
    • The bill legalizes the production of hemp, a form of cannabis with lower THC levels than marijuana.
    • Selected tickers: CGC, OTCPK:MJNA, ACB, GWPH, OTCQB:PHOT, OTCPK:CBIS, APHA, OTCQX:TRTC, CRON, OTCQX:CANN, OTCPK:ERBB, OTCPK:GRNH, OTCQB:PMCB, OTCQB:CVSI, OTC:FITX, MJ, OTCPK:HEMP, OTCQB:CBDS, OTCPK:BLOZF, OTCQB:KSHB, OTCQB:MSRT, OTCQX:SPRWF, TLRY, OTCPK:AGTK, OTCPK:AMMJ, OTCPK:VAPE, HYYDF, OTCQB:GBLX, OTCQB:AERO, OTCQB:MCOA, OTC:HMLSF, OTCQB:CNAB, OTC:FSPM, OTCPK:EAPH, OTCQB:SRNA, OTCQB:RMHB, OTCPK:PLPL, OTCQX:MNTR, OTCPK:EDXC, OTCQX:THCBF, OTC:FSPM, OTCPK:EAPH, OTCQB:SRNA, OTCQB:RMHB, OTCPK:PLPL, OTCQX:MNTR, OTCPK:EDXC, OTCQX:THCBF, OTCQB:KAYS, OTCQB:ENRT, OTCPK:ENDO, OTCQB:NTRR, OTCPK:REFG
     
     
     
     
    | 11:36 AM | 229 Comments
  • GMHLY

    GAM Holding sinks 15% as restructuring scraps 2018 dividend

    • GAM Holdings (OTCPK:GMHLY) drops 15% after the investment firm announces a restructuring plan that suspends its 2018 dividend, cuts staff, and incurs impairment charges.
    • Sees reducing fixed personnel and general expenses by at least CHF 40M by the end of next year.
    • Sees goodwill impairment charge for Group of CHF 885M, impairment of about CHF 62M in H2 2018 related to Cantab investment management and client contracts, non-recurring charge of about CHF 30M for restructuring program.
    • Sees 2018 underlying profit before taxes about CHF 125M vs. CHF 172.5M in 2017.
    • Group assets under management of CHF 139.1B at Nov. 30, 2018 vs. CHF 146.1B at Sept. 30, 2018, driven by net outflows of CHF 4.2B in Investment Management.
    • Previously: GAM Holding to cut about 10% of its investment staff: FT (Nov. 20)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:19 AM
  • KZR

    Kezar Life Sciences adds to up move, shares ahead 16%

    • Thinly traded Kezar Life Sciences (KZR +16%) is up on below-average, adding to its sustained rally after its U.S. debut in June. Shares have more than doubled from its $15 IPO price.
    • The clinical-stage biotech develops treatments for autoimmune disorders and cancer. Lead candidate is KZR-616 for the potential treatment of lupus and lupus nephritis. A Phase 1b/2 study is currently recruiting patients. According to ClinicalTrials.gov, the estimated primary completion date is February 2020. The Phase 2 portion should commence in H1 2019.
    • KZR-616 is a immunoproteasome inhibitor that the company says delivers a broad anti-inflammatory response and has shown potential efficacy in reducing certain autoimmune diseases (e.g., lupus, rheumatoid arthritis, IBD, MS, type 1 diabetes) in animal models.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:16 AM

    • Nano cap Altimmune (NASDAQ:ALT) is down 5% premarket on light volume on the heels of it update for investors on its pipeline activities.
    • Anthrax vaccine candidate NasoShield continues to disappoint. In August, initial data failed to demonstrate an appreciable immune response.   • AAPL

    ITC will review iPhone ban ruling

    • A U.S. tribunal will review a ruling that said an Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) iPhone import ban was not in the public interest even if the devices violate Qualcomm (NASDAQ:QCOM) patents.
    • Qualcomm initiated the ITC case in July of last year alleging that iPhones with Intel chips infringed in the way the phones implanted the chips. Qualcomm later dropped half of the patents from the case.
    • In September, an ITC tribunal ruled Apple infringed on one of the three remaining patents. But the judge recommended that the ITC not give Qualcomm the relief it sought, saying it wasn't in the country's best interest.
    • Now the ITC will decide whether that tribunal was correct that the one patent was in violation and that Qualcomm shouldn't have relief.
    • A final ruling is due before February 19.
    • Apple shares are up 0.8% premarket to $170.50.
    • QCOM is up 0.5% to $58.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:28 AM | 22 Comments
